TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit WSFederationMessage extends System.IdentityModel.Services.FederationMessage
Public MustInherit Class WSFederationMessage Inherits FederationMessage

Docs.summary: Represents a WS-Federation message and defines the base class from which more specialized WS-Federation message classes derive.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage> class represents either a WS-Federation request or a WS-Federation response. More specialized classes that represent specific WS-Federation messages derive from <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage>; for example, the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInRequestMessage> class, which represents a WS-Federation sign-in request message.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage> class exposes several properties that can be used to set or access individual message parameters. These parameters can also be set or accessed through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederationMessage.Parameters%2A> dictionary. For example, you can read the wencoding parameter in the message either through the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage.Encoding%2A> property or by specifying "wencoding" as the key to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.FederationMessage.Parameters%2A> dictionary.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage> contains static methods that you can call to create the appropriate WS-Federation message from: a URL that includes a query string; a base URL and a collection of WS-Federation parameter names and values; or form post data in an HTTP request.
[!INCLUDE[wif_wsfed_ref](~/includes/wif-wsfed-ref-md.md)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Uri baseUrl, string action) cil managed
Public Sub New (baseUrl As Uri, action As String)

Docs.param: The base URL to which the WS-Federation message applies. This is the URL without any query parameters. Sets the property.
The wa parameter of the message. Specifies the action to be performed; for example "wsignin1.0" for a WS-Federation sign-in request. Sets the property.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class from the base URL to which the message applies and the action to be performed (the wa message parameter).
Docs.exception: is not a valid, absolute URI.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Action { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Action : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the wa parameter of the message.
Docs.value: The value of the wa parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The wa parameter specifies the action to be performed. For example, for sign-in scenarios the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage.Action%2A> property is set to "wsignin1.0" and for sign-out scenarios, the property is set to "wsignout1.0" . The wa parameter is required, so this property cannot be set to `null` or an empty string.

Docs.exception: An attempt to set a value that is or empty occurs.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Context { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Context : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the wctx parameter of the message.
Docs.value: The value of the wctx parameter.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Specifies a context value that must be returned with the issued token if it is passed in the request. The value is opaque, that is, its semantics are known only by the originator of the message (typically a relying party - RP); it is not interpreted by the receiver of the message or any intermediaries. The wctx parameter is optional. Set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage.Context%2A> property to `null` or an empty string to remove the wctx parameter from the message.
> [!IMPORTANT] > If your application receives a WS-Federation message with the wctx parameter set, it should ensure that the same value is returned in any response to the sender, or forwarded if the message is passed on to another party.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage CreateFromFormPost(class System.Web.HttpRequestBase request) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateFromFormPost (request As HttpRequestBase) As WSFederationMessage

Docs.param: The request that contains the form post.
Docs.summary: Creates a WS-Federation message from the form post received in the specified request.
Docs.returns: The message that was created or if a message cannot be created.

remarks.format:
## Remarks If a message can be created, the method returns an appropriate implementation of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage> based on the wa parameter submitted in the form post; for example, if wa parameter is "wsignout1.0" then a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignOutRequestMessage> object is returned.
Gets the base URL and the collection of form variables submitted by the client from the request and invokes the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage.CreateFromNameValueCollection%2A> method.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage CreateFromNameValueCollection(class System.Uri baseUrl, class System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection collection) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateFromNameValueCollection (baseUrl As Uri, collection As NameValueCollection) As WSFederationMessage

Docs.param: The base URL to which the message is intended.
The that contains the parameters for the message.
Docs.summary: Creates a WS-Federation message from a of parameters.
Docs.returns: The message that was created or if a message cannot be created.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The parameter collection must contain an entry for the wa parameter, which specifies the action to be performed. If the wa entry is not a recognized action, an exception is thrown. The parameter collection should contain appropriate parameters for the kind of message specified by the wa parameter in the collection. The method will return an appropriate implementation of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage> based on the wa parameter. The following table lists the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage> implementation returned for various parameter combinations.
|Type returned|wa query parameter specified|Comments| |-------------------|----------------------------------|--------------| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.AttributeRequestMessage>|wattr1.0|--| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.PseudonymRequestMessage>|wpseudo1.0|--| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInRequestMessage>|wsignin1.0|`collection` must contain either a wtrealm or a wreply parameter. If `collection` contains a wresult or a wresultptr parameter, a sign-in response message is returned (see next row).| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignInResponseMessage>|wsignin1.0|Returned if `collection` contains a wresult or wresultptr parameter. Only one may be present. If both are present, an exception is thrown.| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignOutRequestMessage>|wsignout1.0|--| |<xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignOutCleanupRequestMessage>|wsignoutcleanup1.0|--|

Docs.exception: The wa parameter in the parameter collection is not recognized.

A sign-in response message has both the wresult and wresultptr parameter in the parameter collection. (A valid sign-in response message has the wa parameter equal to "wsignin1.0" and either the wresult or the wresultptr parameter, but not both.)

MemberSignature.Value: .method public static hidebysig class System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage CreateFromUri(class System.Uri requestUri) cil managed
Public Shared Function CreateFromUri (requestUri As Uri) As WSFederationMessage

Docs.param: The URI from which to create the message. Message parameters are specified in the query string. The wa parameter must be present.
Docs.summary: Creates a WS-Federation message from the specified URI. The parameters are assumed to be specified in the query string.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Returns an appropriate implementation of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage> based on the wa parameter in the query string; for example, if wa parameter is "wsignout1.0" then a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignOutRequestMessage> object is returned.
Other exceptions may be thrown depending on the combination and values of parameters present in the query string.
Invokes the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage.TryCreateFromUri%2A> method.

Docs.exception: A message cannot be created from the specified URI.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::String ^ Encoding { System::String ^ get(); void set(System::String ^ value); };
member this.Encoding : string with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the wencoding parameter of the message.
Docs.value: The value of the wencoding parameter.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Specifies the encoding style to be used for any XML embedded in the message. The wencoding parameter is optional. Set the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage.Encoding%2A> property to `null` or an empty string to remove the wencoding parameter from the message.

MemberSignature.Value: public static bool TryCreateFromUri (Uri requestUri, out System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage fedMsg);
.method public static hidebysig bool TryCreateFromUri(class System.Uri requestUri, [out] class System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage& fedMsg) cil managed
Public Shared Function TryCreateFromUri (requestUri As Uri, ByRef fedMsg As WSFederationMessage) As Boolean
public: static bool TryCreateFromUri(Uri ^ requestUri, [Runtime::InteropServices::Out] System::IdentityModel::Services::WSFederationMessage ^ % fedMsg);

Docs.param: The URI from which to create the message. Message parameters are specified in the query string. The wa parameter must be present.
When this method returns, contains the message that was created or if a message could not be created. This parameter is treated as uninitialized.
Docs.summary: Attempts to create a WS-Federation message from the specified URI. The parameters are assumed to be specified as a query string.
Docs.returns: if a message was successfully created; otherwise, .

remarks.format:
## Remarks If a message can be created, the method returns an appropriate implementation of <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage> based on the wa parameter in the query string; for example, if wa parameter is "wsignout1.0" then a <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.SignOutRequestMessage> object is returned.
Invokes the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Services.WSFederationMessage.CreateFromNameValueCollection%2A> method.
